alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Garfield; Holt (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 11:53AM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow with additional accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information. Blustery winds may result in residual blowing and drifting snow, even after the falling snow stops. Be prepared for slick spots and reduced visibility at times.
